p: The fidelity level (FL) was used to identify the most preferred species for treating certain ailments, showing that the most quoted species were Calotropis gigantea (100%) for dermatological diseases, Drymaria cordata (100%) against fever, Mangifera indica and Wrightia arborea (100%) for gastrointestinal disorders. For treatment of fever also Oxalis corniculata and Centella asiatica were reported, with a FL of 80% and 75%, respectively. Notably a FL of 75% was also found for Curcuma caesia for treatment of maternal ailments. To better underline the therapeutic properties of the most cited medicinal plants, we have reported some information on their main chemical compounds probably involved in the specific curative effect ( Table 7), based on recent pharmacological investigations [ 33, 34, 35, 36, 37, 38, 39].
